title: What are some characteristics of idealism in philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Idealism in philosophy has two main alternative meanings (each having further subdivisions): Platonic Idealism, the original meaning of idealism, holds that the material world is not fully real — or, at least, not as real as the realm of eternal Ideals. The Ideals of most concern are moral: Truth, Beauty, Virtue, Goodness, etc.The idealism associated with Berkeley and others holds that all reality is mental or psychic experience. This might be called psychism to avoid confusion.Concerning the characteristics of Platonic Idealism, here’s a short summary paper: What is Idealism?
